      • createDatabase

        public <T> void createDatabase(java.lang.String packagename)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java database model class with annotations, create a table to match the java bean class. If the table is create the columns will be checked for missing columns which will automatically be added.
        Specified by:
        createDatabase in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        packagename - the name of the package containing the java models, which are to all be created.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - database/table(s) were not created or altered. Note checks for column name matches does not alter if column data type varies at this time.

      • query

        public final <T> T query(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                         java.lang.Object... keyValue)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model, and the vararg of key value pairs, query the database, return match java bean object. Must be a single match.The vararg pairs represent "and" operations in the underlying SQL where clause.
        Specified by:
        query in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        clazz - java table model, with annotations.
        keyValue - set of key value pairs.
        Returns:
        the value of the java bean found, if multiple matches no bean will be returned. A null value indicates NO match, or a multiple match.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - unable to query for the object, there was a failure other then the object was simple not there. Note The following code will return the employee whose name is "John Brown" and works in department 257. 
         
  DatabaseInterface dao = DatabaseFactory.getInstance(dbc);
  Employee emp = dao.query(Employee.class, "name", "John Brown", "dept", 257);

      • queryAll

        public final <T> java.util.List<T> queryAll(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model, return all java beans in the corresponding database table. The annotations in the java table model, indicate database name and table name.
        Specified by:
        queryAll in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the POJO database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        clazz - java table model, with annotations.
        Returns:
        list of java objects in the underlying table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc. Note the returned list will NOT be null, will be valid list of zero to N length.

      • queryList

        @Deprecated
public final <T> java.util.List<T> queryList(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                          java.lang.Object... keyValue)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. 
        Given the java table model, and the vararg of key value pairs, query the database, return matching list of java bean objects. Can be single or multiple matches. The vararg pairs represent "and" operations in the underlying SQL where clause.
        Specified by:
        queryList in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        clazz - java table model, with annotations.
        keyValue - set of key value pairs. 1. key name __pageno__ is the number of page starting at zero 2. key_name __pagesize__ is the size of the page in records.
        Returns:
        the list of the java beans found, the list will always be NON-NULL, but can be of zero length.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc. Note The following code will return the employees who work in department 257, and are full time employees. 
         
  DatabaseInterface dao = DatabaseFactory.getInstance(dbc);
  Employee emp = dao.query(Employee.class, "dept", 257, "fulltime", true);

      • queryList

        public <T> java.util.List<T> queryList(java.lang.Class<T> tableClass,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model, and the vararg of key value pairs, query the database, return matching list of java bean objects. Can be single or multiple matches. The vararg pairs represent "and" operations in the underlying SQL where clause.
        Specified by:
        queryList in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        tableClass - java table model, with annotations.
        Returns:
        the list of the java beans found, the list will always be NON-NULL, but can be of zero length.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc. Note The following code will return the employees who work in department 257, and are full time employees. 
         
  DatabaseInterface dao = DatabaseFactory.getInstance(dbc);
  Employee emp = dao.query(Employee.class, "dept", 257, "fulltime", true);

      • queryList

        public <T> java.util.List<T> queryList(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                       Predicate<T> filter,
                                       java.util.List<com.viper.database.model.ColumnParam> columnParams,
                                       com.viper.database.model.LimitParam limitParam,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model, the pageno, the number of rows in a page, and the vararg of key value pairs, query the database, return matching list of java bean objects. Can be single or multiple matches. The vararg pairs represent "and" operations in the underlying SQL where clause.
        Specified by:
        queryList in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        clazz - java table model, with annotations.
        filter - the filter for the rows, all rows read and then filter is applied, can be slow.
        Returns:
        the list of the java beans found, the list will always be NON-NULL, but can be of zero length.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc. Note The following code will return a page of up to 20 employees who are full time employees. 
         
  DatabaseInterface dao = DatabaseFactory.getInstance(dbc);
  List emps = dao.queryPage(Employee.class, new Predicate() {
        @Override
        public boolean apply(Employee e) {
                return e.getWeeklyHours() >= 36;
        }
 }

        public final <T> void delete(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                             java.lang.Object... keyValue)

        Specified by:
        delete in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        clazz - java table model, with annotations.
        keyValue - set of key value pairs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc. Note The following code will delete the employee(s) whose name is "John Brown" and works in department 257. 
         
  DatabaseInterface dao = DatabaseFactory.getInstance(dbc);
  Employee emp = dao.query(Employee.class, "name", "John Brown", "dept", 257);

      • delete

        public final <T> void delete(T bean)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model bean, delete the matching java bean objects, physically from table. The bean will be deleted using primary key, if available, otherwise deletion will fail.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        bean - java bean of table model class, with annotations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc.

                         throws java.lang.Exception

      • update

        public <T> T update(T bean)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model bean, insert or update the bean into the database. If the primary key is specified in the model, and the value of the primary key is not null or not zero, then update the database using the primary key value. If the primary key is null or zero, then insert the bean into the database. If the primary key value is auto increment, then the bean's primary key value will be populated on return.
        Specified by:
        update in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        bean - java table model bean, with annotations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc.

      • insert

        public final <T> T insert(T bean)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model bean, insert or update the bean into the database. If the primary key is specified in the model, and the value of the primary key is not null or not zero, then update the database using the primary key value. If the primary key is null or zero, then insert the bean into the database. If the primary key value is auto increment, then the bean's primary key value will be populated on return.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        bean - java table model bean, with annotations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc.

      • insertAll

        public final <T> void insertAll(java.util.List<T> beans)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model beans, insert or update the beans into the database. If the primary key is specified in the model, and the value of the primary key is not null or not zero, then update the database using the primary key value. If the primary key is null or zero, then insert the bean into the database. If the primary key value is auto increment, then all of the bean's primary key value will be populated on return.
        Specified by:
        insertAll in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        beans - java table model beans, with annotations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc.

      • uniqueValues

        public final <T> java.util.List<java.lang.Object> uniqueValues(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                               java.lang.String fieldName)
                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Given the java table model, and a field name. Return all available values for that field that exist in the database table. This requires a read of the entire table. The list will return unique values, which will be sorted alpha numerically.
        Specified by:
        uniqueValues in interface DatabaseInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the pojo database bean, annotated with classes from package com.viper.database.annotations
        Parameters:
        clazz - java table model, with annotations.
        fieldName - he name of the field for which possible values is being asked for.
        Returns:
        list of values for the specified field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - failure to get table data, no database, no table, bad connection, etc. Note the returned list will NOT be null, will be valid list of zero to N length. Note The following call will return all the ages for the employees which actually exist in the database. The list of ages will be unique and sorted. 
         
  DatabaseInterface dao = DatabaseFactory.getInstance(dbc);
  List<Object> values = dao.uniqueValues(Employee.class, "age");
